quotes.quote: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain; and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Mathematics may be defined as the subject in which we never know what we are talking about, nor whether what we are saying is true.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Mathematics, rightly viewed, possesses not only truth, but supreme beauty - a beauty cold and austere, like that of sculpture.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Mathematics is the queen of the sciences.
quotes.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

quotes.quote: I went off to college planning to major in math or philosophy-- of course, both those ideas are really the same idea.
quotes.author: Frank Wilczek

quotes.quote: In mathematics you don't understand things. You just get used to them.
quotes.author: Johann von Neumann

quotes.quote: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Proof is the idol before whom the pure mathematician tortures himself.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: The mathematics is not there till we put it there.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: We used to think that if we knew one, we knew two, because one and one are two. We are finding that we must learn a great deal more about 'and'.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: If scientific reasoning were limited to the logical processes of arithmetic, we should not get very far in our understanding of the physical world. One might as well attempt to grasp the game of poker entirely by the use of the mathematics of probability.
quotes.author: Vannevar Bush
